THE SUPREME COURT OF APPEAL OF SOUTH AFRICA
CASE NUMBER: 4/95

applicants: Ensign Bickford (South Africa) (Pty) Ltd. and Others

sections.facts: The applicant, Ensign Bickford (South Africa) (Pty) Ltd. together with other parties, brought an action against AECI Explosives and Chemicals Ltd. The dispute arose out of a commercial relationship concerning the supply and use of explosive chemicals, but the judgment excerpt does not provide detailed factual background.
sections.issues: The principal legal issues involved the interpretation of the contractual obligations between the parties, liability for any alleged breaches, and any applicable statutory or case law governing the sale and handling of explosive materials.
sections.principles: The court would consider principles of contract law, including the doctrine of offer, acceptance, consideration, and performance, as well as any specific regulatory provisions applicable to explosives and chemicals. Standard precedents on breach of contract and remedies would also be relevant.
sections.application: Applying those principles, the court would assess whether the respondent fulfilled its contractual duties, whether the applicant suffered any loss as a result of a breach, and what remedies, if any, were appropriate under South African law.
